name: SAKSHI
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began wrestling at age 12 at Choturam Stadium in Rohtak, India. (sportskeeda.com, 05 Apr 2016; YouTube, 26 Feb 2014)'), ('Reason', '"I always wanted to be different. There were very few girls, so I had to train with boys mostly." (sportskeeda.com, 05 Apr 2016)'), ('Coach', 'Kuldip Malik [national], IND (hindustantimes.com, 28 Apr 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a medal at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (yourstory.com, 27 Nov 2017)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning bronze in the 58kg category at the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. (drilers.com, 14 Jan 2018)'), ('Awards', 'In April 2017 she received the Padma Shri Award from the Indian government. (thehindu.com, 13 Apr 2017)In August 2016 she was presented with the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award, which is the highest sporting honour for Indian athletes. (thehindu.com, 29 Aug 2016)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralNATIONAL FIRSTShe became the first female wrestler representing India to win a medal at the Olympic Games when she claimed bronze in the 58kg category at the 2016 Games in Rio de Janeiro. (SportsDeskOnline, 22 Jul 2018; ONS, 17 Aug 2016)BRAND AMBASSADORShe has worked as an ambassador for \'Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao\', a campaign initiated by the Indian government to promote the welfare of girls in the state of Haryana. "I am privileged to be the face of this campaign in Haryana. I try and promote it in every way I can. I speak about it at every public occasion as I believe the more we talk about this, the more we will be aware and create awareness. It is a great honour to be named the brand ambassador of such a campaign; it is a great opportunity for me to help girls and do something for the women of our country." (yourstory.com, 27 Nov 2017)OCCUPATIONShe joined the Indian Railways under a sports quota programme that allows her to train and compete internationally. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 15 Apr 2018) '), ('Hero', 'Indian freestyle wrestler Sushil Kumar. (sportskeeda.com, 05 Apr 2016)'), ('Education', 'Physical Education - Maharshi Dayanand University, Rohtak, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationOlympic Games3Freestyle 58 kg2016Rio de Janeiro, BRAWorld Championships8Freestyle 60 kg2014Tashkent, UZB14Freestyle 60 kg2017Paris, FRA16Freestyle 63 kg2012Sherwood Park, AB, CANAsian Championships2Freestyle 60 kg2017New Delhi, IND3Freestyle 62 kg2018Bishkek, KGZ3Freestyle 60 kg2015Doha, QAT5Freestyle 60 kg2016Bangkok, THA5Freestyle 60 kg2014Astana, KAZCommonwealth Games2Freestyle 58 kg2014Glasgow, GBR3Freestyle 62 kg2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS')]

[('Beginning', 'He got involved in athletics at an early age at Navdeep Stadium in Narwana, India. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 29 Aug 2018)'), ('Reason', 'He followed his father into the sport. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 29 Aug 2018)'), ('Coach', 'Amrish Kumar [personal], IND (scroll.in, 28 Aug 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralTOUGH TIMESHe came close to quitting the sport in 2016 after his employer, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation of India [ONGC], decided to not renew his contract. He found it difficult to cover his training costs as his father was the only member of his family that was earning a salary. However, he then met coach Amrish Kumar, who motivated him to persevere. "I was on stipend for three years and then they told me I wasn\'t going to be made permanent. I was almost ready to quit the sport. I was 27 and still taking support from my parents." (scroll.in, 28 Aug 2018; espn.in, 27 Aug 2018) '), ('Relatives', 'His father Randhir Singh Chahal competed in shot put at state level in India. name: ANKUR
bio: [('Beginning', 'He began shooting at age 16 in India. (thebridge.in, 09 Mar 2018)'), ('Reason', 'A badminton player at school, he was inspired to take up shooting after seeing Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore win a silver medal in men\'s double trap at the 2004 Olympic Games in Athens. "Rathore was our family friend. My dad used to shoot with him so seeing him on TV winning that medal was great. Back then I didn\'t know he was the first Indian shooter to win an Olympic medal. Once he returned, he was a constant on news channels and newspapers. I wanted to be like him." (thebridge.in, 09 Mar 2018)'), ('Coach', 'Marcello Dradi [national], ITA (sportsauthorityofindia.nic.in, 13 Feb 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a gold medal at the Olympic Games. (business-standard.com, 03 Mar 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning a silver medal in double trap at the 2017 World Championships in Moscow, Russian Federation. (results.gc2018.com, 03 Nov 2017)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralCHANGING DISCIPLINEHe began his career as a trap shooter before taking up double trap in 2012. He plans to switch back to trap after the 2018 Asian Games because of the International Shooting Sport Federation\'s [ISSF] recommendation to remove double trap from the programme at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. "It\'s really disappointing. It\'s not just because I can\'t shoot double trap at the Olympics, but because the effort that I have put in and the time that I have given to this discipline over the past seven or eight years won\'t give me anything now. One decision and that\'s changed everything for me. That\'s what hurts the most. But I can\'t afford to cry over that. I have to take this decision in my stride and try to find a place for myself somewhere else. Many shooters across the world have already moved on and are trying their hand at trap or skeet. Some of them even made to their respective national teams. I see that as an encouraging sign. It won\'t be easy, but that doesn\'t mean it\'s not possible. I have to give my best and then let\'s see how things pan out." (thebridge.in, 09 Mar 2018) '), ('Relatives', 'His brother Ajay Mittal has represented India in shooting, competing in double trap at World Cup events. His father Ashok Mittal has competed in the sport at national level in India. (SportsDeskOnline, 11 Apr 2018; thebridge.in, 09 Mar 2018)'), ('Education', 'Humanities - Hansraj College, Delhi, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Hobbies', 'Cars. (results.gc2018.com, 03 Nov 2017)'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultAsian Games6Double Trap Team2014Incheon, KOR3987Double Trap2014Incheon, KOR136World Championships2Double Trap2017Moscow, RUS6616Double Trap2015Lonato, ITA13416Double Trap2014Granada, ESP13835Double Trap2013Lima, PER112World Cup Final4Double Trap2017New Delhi, IND45World Cup1Double Trap2017Acapulco, MEX752Double Trap2017New Delhi, IND749Double Trap2016Baku, AZE13711Double Trap2015Larnaca, CYP13812Double Trap2015Acapulco, MEX13717Double Trap2015Qabala, AZE13919Double Trap2017Larnaca, CYP12721Double Trap2016Rio de Janeiro, BRA13122Double Trap2016San Marino, SMR13228Double Trap2016Nicosia, CYP12433Double Trap2015Al Ain, UAE131Asian Championships1Double Trap2017Astana, KAZ711Double Trap2014Al Ain, UAE283Double Trap2016Abu Dhabi, UAE308Double Trap2015Kuwait City, KUW13715Double Trap2013Almaty, KAZ127Commonwealth Games3Double Trap2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS53')]

name: ANJUM
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began shooting in 2009 in India. (anjummoudgil.in, 01 Jul 2014)'), ('Reason', 'Her mother, a university-level shooter herself, introduced her to the sport. She initially began as a pistol shooter and joined the National Cadet Corps [NCC] programme at her school. "I started with pistol shooting, but when I joined the NCC, there were only rifles available. I experimented with rifle shooting and found it more interesting. From that day, pistols became passe." (yespunjab.com, 21 Feb 2013)'), ('Coach', 'Deepali Deshpande [national], IND (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 10 Mar 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (indianexpress.com, 01 Feb 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning an individual medal at a shooting event in Kuwait despite competing with a shoulder injury. (results.gc2018.com, 30 Oct 2017)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralPASSIONATE HOBBYShe enjoys painting during her spare time, and feels the hobby is beneficial to her sporting career. "I can\'t keep off painting, even when I\'m away for a tournament. I can paint anything. It definitely helps me relax. When I am painting I don\'t think about anything else. I don\'t feel hungry or thirsty. I get completely lost. Whatever you do, it requires full focus. When I am painting, I get into that mode. That requires concentration, which ultimately helps in my training for shooting. I don\'t do any other meditation exercises." (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 18 Mar 2018; indianexpress.com, 17 Mar 2018)OCCUPATIONShe joined the Punjab Police under a sports quota programme that allows her to train and compete internationally. (indianexpress.com, 01 Feb 2018) '), ('Hero', 'Coach Deepali Deshpande. (results.gc2018.com, 30 Oct 2017)'), ('Injuries', 'In 2014 she injured her back and her left shoulder while training with a heavy rifle. She underwent a rehabilitation period of three months at her home in Chandigarh, India. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 10 Mar 2018)'), ('Education', 'Psychology - Panjab University, Chandigarh, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Hobbies', 'Painting. (indiatimes.com, 18 Mar 2018)'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultWorld Cup250m Rifle 3 Positions2018Guadalajara, MEX454.2410m Air Rifle2018Guadalajara, MEX208.6650m Rifle 3 Positions2018Munich, GER413.4910m Air Rifle2016Baku, AZE416.41550m Rifle 3 Positions2017New Delhi, IND5781550m Rifle 3 Positions2016Munich, GER5822010m Air Rifle2018Changwon, KOR625.52510m Air Rifle2018Munich, GER626.43350m Rifle 3 Positions2016Baku, AZE5714350m Rifle 3 Positions2015Munich, GER5774650m Rifle 3 Positions2018Changwon, KOR11564650m Rifle 3 Positions2015Qabala, AZE5755950m Rifle 3 Positions2015Fort Benning, GA, USA571Asian Championships410m Air Rifle2017Wako, JPN207.6610m Air Rifle2016Tehran, IRI122.11450m Rifle 3 Positions2015Kuwait City, KUW577South Asian Games150m Rifle 3 Positions2016Guwahati, IND150m Rifle 3 Positions Team2016Guwahati, INDCommonwealth Games250m Rifle 3 Positions2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS455.71650m Rifle Prone2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS602.2Junior World Championships650m Rifle 3 Positions Team2014Granada, ESP1721World Ranking (as of 01 Aug 2018)750m Rifle 3 Positions20187991910m Air Rifle2018328')]

name: SAINA
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began playing badminton at age eight at a summer training camp at the Lal Bahadur Shastri Stadium, Hyderabad, India. (ezinearticles.com, 27 Jun 2010)'), ('Reason', 'Her parents were both badminton players. (olympicgoldquest.in, 16 Aug 2015)'), ('Coach', 'Pullela Gopichand [club, national], IND (sportskeeda.com, 10 Mar 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a medal at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 05 Nov 2017)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning gold at the 2010 Commonwealth Games in Delhi, India. (olympicgoldquest.in, 16 Aug 2015)'), ('Awards', "In 2016 she received the Padma Bhushan, the third-highest civilian award given by the Indian government. (ONS, 20 Jul 2016)She was named Sports Illustrated India's Sportsperson of the Year in 2009 and 2013. (zeenews.india.com, 01 Oct 2013)In 2010 she received a Padma Shri, the fourth-highest civilian award given by the Indian government. (olympicgoldquest.in, 29 Aug 2013)In 2010 she received the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna [RGKR], India's highest honour for achievements in sport. (olympicgoldquest.in, 29 Aug 2013)In 2009 she received an Arjuna Award in recognition of her outstanding achievements in badminton. (olympicgoldquest.in, 29 Aug 2013)She was named 2009 CNN-IBN Indian of the Year in the sports category. (sportskeeda.com, 20 Dec 2013)She was named 2008 Most Promising Player of the Year by the Badminton World Federation [BWF]. (ONS, 20 Jul 2016)"), ('Additional Information', "GeneralNATIONAL FIRSTSShe became the first Indian badminton player to win gold at the world junior championships when she was triumphant in singles at the 2008 edition of the tournament in Pune, India. In 2009 she became the first Indian badminton player to win a Badminton World Federation [BWF] Super Series title when she claimed victory in singles at the Indonesian Open in Jakarta. In 2010 she also became the first Indian female athlete to win an individual gold medal in badminton at the Commonwealth Games when she was victorious in singles at the Games in Delhi, India. At the 2012 Olympic Games in London, she claimed India's first Olympic medal in badminton by winning bronze in singles. She is also the first Indian badminton player to have competed at three Olympic Games, having participated at the 2008, 2012 and 2016 editions of the Games. (SportsDeskOnline, 31 Jul 2018; ONS, 20 Jul 2016; olympicgoldquest.in, 16 Aug 2015)AUTOBIOGRAPHYIn 2012 she published an autobiography titled 'Playing To Win, My Life On And Off Court'. name: LEANDER ADRIAN
bio: [('Beginning', 'He began playing tennis at age 10 in India. (Athlete, 29 Sep 1999)'), ('Reason', 'He has a great passion for the sport and considered playing tennis to be a great career option. (Athlete, 29 Sep 1999)'), ('Debut', 'Turned professional in 1991'), ('Coach', 'Zeeshan Ali [national] (scroll.in, 07 Apr 2018)'), ('Training', 'In addition to practising on the court, he does yoga, running, stretching and strength and conditioning work in the gym. (livemint.com, 12 Apr 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win gold at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (livemint.com, 12 Apr 2018)'), ('Memorable', "Winning bronze in men's singles at the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta. (indianexpress.com, 25 Jun 2016)"), ('Awards', 'In 2014 he was presented with the Padma Bhushan Award in recognition of his service to Indian sport. (atpworldtour.com, 27 Jun 2016)In 2001 he received the Padma Shri Award in India. (atpworldtour.com, 27 Jun 2016)He was flag bearer for India at the opening ceremony of the 2000 Olympic Games in Sydney. (atpworldtour.com, 27 Jun 2016)'), ('Additional Information', "GeneralHISTORIC ACHIEVEMENTSAt the 2012 Olympic Games in London he became the first Indian athlete to compete in six Olympic Games. He extended this to seven at the 2016 Games in Rio de Janeiro. His bronze medal in the men's singles event at the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta was India's first individual Olympic medal since 1952 and first Olympic tennis medal. In 1999 he and his countryman Mahesh Bhupathi became the first doubles pairing to reach the final of all four Grand Slams in the same year since 1952. In June 2016 he became the first male player to win 10 Grand Slam mixed doubles titles when he triumphed in the 2016 French Open with Swiss partner Martina Hingis, thus completing a career slam in the mixed doubles. In April 2018 he became the most successful doubles player in the Davis Cup after earning his 43rd win in the competition. (scroll.in, 07 Apr 2018; indianexpress.com, 25 Jun 2016, 04 Jun 2016; lmt-lss.com, 03 Sep 2015; ATP, 12 Sep 2015, 25 Aug 2006)OTHER ACTIVITIESHe played the lead role in the Indian movie 'Rajdhani Express', a thriller that was released in 2013. (newsmobile.in, 09 Apr 2018) "), ('Hero', 'Brazilian footballer Pele, Australian tennis player Rod Laver, US boxer Muhammad Ali. (tennis-prose.com, 26 Nov 2010)'), ('Relatives', 'His father Vece Paes played field hockey for India, winning a bronze medal at the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich. His mother Jennifer Paes represented India in basketball. (atpworldtour.com, 27 Jun 2016)'), ('Injuries', 'In 2003 he was admitted to hospital with a suspected brain tumour that was later found to be a parasitic infection. (indianlink.com.au, 09 Feb 2018)He suffered a torn tendon in his right wrist in 2000, and required a three-month break from competition. name: Chitra
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up athletics in grade seven of school in Kerala, India. (thenewsminute.com, 25 Jul 2017)'), ('Reason', 'Her physical education teacher at school Sjin NS recognised her potential and encouraged her to take up athletics. "When I was in class seven I was intrigued by the senior girls taking part in sports events, and decided to take part in school competitions myself. It was some two years later that I began to win medals. Since class nine I don\'t remember winning anything less than a gold medal." (yourstory.com, 17 Jul 2017; herstoryapp.com, 12 Mar 2018; thenewsminute.com, 25 Jul 2017)'), ('Coach', 'Nikolai Snesarev [national], BLR; Sjin NS [personal], IND (sportstarlive.com, 12 Dec 2017; timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 10 Jul 2017)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralWORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS EXCLUSIONShe filed a complaint to the High Court of Kerala in India after she was not included in the Indian squad for the 2017 World Championships in London, England. The High Court of Kerala ruled in her favour and directed the Athletics Federation of India [AFI] to include her in the squad for the championships. However, the AFI\'s application to include her in the squad was rejected by the International Association of Athletics Federations [IAAF] as the deadline for squad submissions has passed. "I had performed my level best at the [2017] Asian Championships and had won the gold medal, despite the unfavourable weather conditions during the race. And I was told my gold medal would be my direct ticket to the World Championships in London. When my coach Sijin informed me that my name was not on the list of participants, I was devastated." (herstoryapp.com, 12 Mar 2018; outlookindia.com, 20 Sep 2017; newindianexpress.com, 30 Jul 2017; thenewsminute.com, 25 Jul 2017; timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 30 Jul 2017) '), ('Influence', 'Her coach Sjin NS. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 10 Jul 2017)'), ('Education', 'VTB College, Palakkad, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi, Malayalam'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultAsian Championships11500m2017Bhubaneswar, IND4:17.92South Asian Games11500m2016India4:25.59')]

name: SAJAN PRAKASH
bio: [('Beginning', 'He began swimming at age six. (thanyapura.com, 14 Jun 2017)'), ('Reason', 'His mother encouraged him to try sports. She enrolled him in a number of sports including swimming, tennis and football, and would even bribe him with chocolate to participate, but he remained disinterested. Finally, at age 10, he started taking an active interest in swimming after winning a medal at a local competition. (thanyapura.com, 14 Jun 2017; newindianexpress.com, 18 Jul 2014)'), ('Coach', 'Pradeep Kumar [club], IND; Miguel Lopez, ESP (fina.org, 23 Nov 2017; deccanherald.com, 14 Oct 2017)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (espn.com, 07 Apr 2018)'), ('Awards', 'He was named the Best Male Athlete of the 2015 National Games in Kerala, India. (Facebook page, 28 May 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralOCCUPATIONHe joined the Kerala Police under a sports quota programme that allows him to train and compete internationally. (hindustantimes.com, 10 Dec 2017)SCHOLARSHIPIn 2017 he was one of 36 athletes from across the world to receive an International Swimming Federation [FINA] Scholarship, which was designed to help the athletes to qualify and participate at the 2017 World Championships in Budapest, Hungary. The scholarship also presented the athletes with the option to train at FINA-approved training centres in Thailand, the United States of America and Senegal. He had previously received a scholarship from FINA in preparation for the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. (fina.org, 01 Mar 2017; Facebook profile, 08 Jul 2016) '), ('Hero', 'US swimmer Michael Phelps, South African swimmer Chad Le Clos, Japanese swimmer Daiya Seto. (fina.org, 18 Nov 2015)'), ('Influence', 'His mother, coaches Pradeep Kumar, Saji Sebastian and Joy Joseph Thoppan. (gamatics.in, 26 Oct 2015; fina.org, 23 Nov 2017)'), ('Relatives', 'His mother Shanty Mohl represented India in athletics. (sportskeeda.com, 24 Jul 2015)'), ('Nickname', 'Indian Michael Phelps. (thenewsminute.com, 14 Jul 2016)'), ('Injuries', 'He injured his shoulder at the 2016 South Asian Games in India. (thanyapura.com, 14 Jun 2017)He contracted typhoid two months before the Indian selection trials for the 2014 Commonwealth Games. He recovered in time to qualify for the Games in Glasgow, Scotland. bio: [('Beginning', 'He began playing badminton at age 10 in Kerala, India. name: Seema
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up athletics at age 11. (Commonwealth Games, 2006)'), ('Reason', 'She initially tried hurdles and long jump before her brother encouraged her to take up discus throw. (hindustantimes.com, 27 Mar 2018; Commonwealth Games, 2006)'), ('Coach', 'Ankush Punia [personal, husband], IND (newindianexpress.com, 15 Apr 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (dnaindia.com, 21 Mar 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning a gold medal in discus throw at the 2014 Asian Games in Incheon, Republic of Korea. (firstpost.com, 30 Sep 2014)'), ('Awards', 'In 2006 she received the Bhim Award from the state government of Haryana, India. (daughterofindia.com, 29 Mar 2010)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralSANCTIONShe tested positive for the prohibited substance pseudoephedrine at the 2000 World Junior Championships in Santiago, Chile, an event she had won the gold medal in discus throw. She was stripped of the gold medal and received a warning from the Amateur Athletic Federation of India [AAFI]. She also tested positive for banned substance stanozolol ahead of the 2006 Asian Games in Doha, Qatar. She was found innocent of any wrongdoing by the Athletics Federation of India [AFI] and cleared to compete, but she chose to withdraw from the Games citing personal reasons. (newindianexpress.com, 30 Sep 2014; thehindu.com, 02 Oct 2001; rediff.com, 08 Dec 2006; hindustantimes.com, 27 Mar 2018) '), ('Relatives', 'Her husband Ankush has represented India in discus, and competed at the 2004 Olympic Games in Athens. name: V. SINDHU
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began playing badminton at age eight. She initially trained at the Indian Railway Institute of Signal Engineering and Telecommunications in Secunderabad, India, before joining Gopichand Academy in Hyderabad in 2008. (firstpost.com, 26 Feb 2018; ONS, 20 Jul 2016)'), ('Reason', '"My dad used to play volleyball and I would accompany him to the volleyball courts when I was very young. There was a badminton court beside the volleyball courts and I initially only played for fun, but I gradually developed a great interest and love for badminton." (rediff.com, 03 Jan 2012)'), ('Debut', '2010 for India (hindustantimes.com, 29 Aug 2016)'), ('Coach', 'Pullela Gopichand [national], IND (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 08 Mar 2018, 21 Feb 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a gold medal at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 20 Feb 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning silver in the singles event at the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. (bwfbadminton.com, 19 Aug 2016)'), ('Awards', 'She was flag bearer for India at the opening ceremony of the 2018 Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast, QLD, Australia. (gc2018.com, 04 Apr 2018)In August 2016 she received the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award, the highest sporting honour in India. (thehindu.com, 29 Aug 2016)In 2015 she was presented with a Padma Shri, the fourth-highest civilian award given by the Indian government. (sports.ndtv.com, 30 Mar 2015)She was named the 2014 Breakthrough Sportsperson of the Year by the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry [FICCI]. (news.biharprabha.com, 13 Feb 2014)She was named the 2013 CNN-IBN Indian of the Year in the sports category. (sportskeeda.com, 20 Dec 2013)In 2013 she received the Arjuna Award in recognition of her outstanding achievements in badminton. (ONS, 20 Jul 2016; daijiworld.com, 25 Sep 2013)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralNATIONAL FIRSTSIn 2016 she became the first athlete representing India to win a silver medal in badminton at the Olympic Games by finishing runner-up in the singles event in Rio de Janeiro. In 2013 she became the first Indian female to claim a medal in the singles event at the world championships when she took bronze in Guangzhou, People\'s Republic of China. (SportsDeskOnline, 19 Aug 2016; ONS, 20 Jul 2016; olympicgoldquest.in, 18 Jan 2015)GIFT FROM HER HEROShe received the gift of a new car from Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar as a reward for winning a gold medal at the 2012 Asian Junior Championships in Gimcheon, Republic of Korea. "The car is very special to me. To be given a gift by Sachin was like living a dream." (telegraphindia.com, 23 Mar 2014) '), ('Hero', 'Indian badminton players Pullela Gopichand and Saina Nehwal, Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar. (telegraphindia.com, 23 Mar 2014; sportskeeda.com, 14 May 2013; rediff.com, 03 Jan 2012)'), ('Influence', 'Her parents, and coach Pullela Gopichand. (telegraphindia.com, 23 Mar 2014; sportskeeda.com, 14 May 2013)'), ('Relatives', 'Her father PV Ramana won a bronze medal in volleyball at the 1986 Asian Games in Seoul, Republic of Korea. Her mother P Vijaya was a professional volleyball player. (hindustantimes.com, 29 Aug 2016; ONS, 20 Jul 2016; olympicgoldquest.in, 18 Jan 2015)'), ('Injuries', "She sprained her right ankle ahead of the 2018 Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast, QLD, Australia, but was still able to compete at the event. (newsx.com, 03 Apr 2018)In 2015 she was unable to compete or train for four months after suffering a stress fracture to her left foot. She first noticed the pain in 2014, but she thought it was just stiffness and decided to continue playing. (hindustantimes.com, 29 Aug 2016; economictimes.indiatimes.com, 10 Aug 2015)She missed the 2012 World Junior Championships in Chiba, Japan, after sustaining a knee injury at the Super Series event in People's Republic of China the previous month. (dnaindia.com, 13 Oct 2012)"), ('Education', "Commerce - St. Ann's College for Women, India"), ('Languages', 'English'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationAsian Games3Team2014Incheon, KORLast (Athlete, 24 Aug 2018)'), ('Additional Information', "GeneralPROTESTIn July 2016 she filed a complaint with the High Court of Kerala against the Athletics Federation of India [AFI], protesting her exclusion from the 4x400m relay team for the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. She claimed she was left out of the squad for choosing to train with her personal coach PB Jaikumar, instead of joining national coach Yuri Ogorodnik's training camp. The High Court of Kerala ruled in her favour and asked the AFI to include her in the squad, but the deadline for squad submissions had passed and she was unable to compete at the Games. (newindianexpress.com, 02 Jun 2017; thenewsminute.com, 27 Jul 2016; english.manoramaonline.com, 22 Jul 2016) "), ('Hero', 'Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar, Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt. (sportskeeda.com, 26 Mar 2016)She was named Player of the Tournament at the 2013 Junior World Cup in Monchengladbach, Germany, and Best Young Player at the 2010 World Cup in Rosario, Argentina. (gosportsfoundation.in, 05 Aug 2010; hockeyindia.org, 05 Aug 2013)She was included in the International Hockey Federation [FIH] All-Star team in 2010, and nominated for the FIH Young Player of the Year award in 2010, 2013 and 2014. (indianexpress.com, 19 Jul 2015. fih.ch, 06 May 2016)"), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralEARLY DAYSShe comes from a poor background in Shahabad, Haryana, where her father worked as a cart-puller, transporting goods by hand. When she was growing up she had to decide on following her passion for hockey or taking responsibility for her family. She chose to do both, although it was not a universally popular decision. "In my neighbourhood, people asked my parents to not let me wear shorts and play hockey. They felt I might bring a bad name to the family." She asked her parents for one chance to prove herself, and they managed to enrol her at the Shahabad Hockey Academy. When she first entered the academy at age seven, coach Baldev Singh rejected her, saying she was too frail, but she did not give up and returned the following day. The coach ignored the academy\'s rule not to admit any girl under the age of eight and allowed her to train. "She was so gifted that I had to relax the rule for her, and I am glad I did," Singh said. She eventually made her senior debut for India at age 14 and went on to become part of the team that won bronze at the 2013 Junior World Cup in Monchengladbach, Germany. (sportskeeda.com, 16 Apr 2015; indianexpress.com, 19 Jul 2015; fih.ch, 06 Nov 2015) '), ('Influence', 'Coach Baldev Singh. (Athlete, 17 Aug 2018)'), ('Nickname', 'Rano (Athlete, 17 Aug 2018)'), ('Injuries', "In April 2016 she injured her ankle in a match against Ireland at the Hawke's Bay Cup in New Zealand. (newindianexpress.com, 10 Apr 2016)She missed nine months with a dislocated shoulder and a back injury, before returning to action in June 2015. (sportskeeda.com, 16 Apr 2015; zeenews.india.com, 24 Jun 2015; Athlete, 17 Aug 2018)"), ('Education', 'Kurukshetra University, India'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi, Punjabi'), ('Hobbies', 'Listening to music, shopping, going to the gym. (Athlete, 17 Aug 2018)'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationAsian Games3Women2014Incheon, KOR4Women2010Guangzhou, CHNOlympic Games12Women2016Rio de Janeiro, BRAWorld Cup8Women2018London, GBR9Women2010Rosario, ARGAsia Cup1Women2017Kakamigahara, JPN2Women2009Bangkok, THA3Women2013Kuala Lumpur, MAS')]

name: RASHMI
bio: [('Beginning', "She began shooting at age eight on her family's farm in Secunderabad, India. She was given an air gun as a gift by her grandfather. She began training in 2006. (sportstaronnet.com, 22 Feb 2012; newindianexpress.com, 16 May 2012)"), ('Reason', '"I come from an army background, and although I liked shooting once in a while, I never wanted to take it up professionally, not one bit! My grandfather, an ex-army man himself, gave me his air rifle and my dad taught me how to shoot a shotgun to ward off thieves in our isolated locality, that was about it. But one day he took me for the 49th Nationals and told me \'you\'re going to compete in the 50th Nationals next year.\' He took me for training every day in the shooting range, and true enough, I was shooting at the Nationals the following year." (indiatimes.com, 26 Nov 2016)'), ('Debut', '2008 for India, World Cup in Suhl, Germany (sportstaronnet.com, 22 Feb 2012; newindianexpress.com, 16 May 2012)'), ('Coach', 'M Padmanabhan [national], IND; Ennio Falco [national], ITA (hindustantimes.com, 30 Apr 2018; sportstarlive.com, 13 Aug 2017; thenrai.in, 09 May 2017)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (indiatimes.com, 26 Nov 2016)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning two medals [a gold and a silver] at the 2017 Asian Championships in Astana, Kazakhstan. (telanganatoday.com, 14 Aug 2017)'), ('Influence', 'Her father. (wionews.com, 02 Sep 2017)'), ('Education', 'Accounting, Finance - The Hague University of Applied Sciences, Netherlands'), ('Languages', 'English'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultAsian Games20Skeet2014Incheon, KOR52World Championships25Skeet Team2017Moscow, RUS9055Skeet2017Moscow, RUS60World Cup17Skeet2017New Delhi, IND6619Skeet2018Guadalajara, MEX10519Skeet2017Acapulco, MEX6422Skeet2016Baku, AZE6730Skeet2016Nicosia, CYP6532Skeet2018Tucson, AZ, USA10049Skeet2016San Marino, SMR61Asian Championships4Skeet2017Astana, KAZ329Skeet2016Abu Dhabi, UAE6711Skeet2015Kuwait City, KUW6712Skeet2012Patiala, IND58World Ranking (as of 01 Aug 2018)56Skeet201827')]

name: Manish Singh
bio: [('Beginning', 'He took up race walking at age 15. (scroll.in, 03 Jan 2017)'), ('Reason', 'His father died in 2002 so he worked to help support the family. "My family was in such a crisis. I used to make tea, paranthas and even serve food. Those were really testing times. I had two unmarried sisters and a young brother at home. Every penny counted. I saw athletics as a means of getting a government job, so kept pushing hard." (indiatoday.intoday.in, 07 Jan 2016)'), ('Coach', 'Alexander Artsybashev [national], RUS (indianexpress.com, 17 Feb 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (sportskeeda.com, 30 Mar 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralOCCUPATIONHe joined the Uttarakhand Police under a sports quota programme that allows him to train and compete internationally. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 28 Dec 2017)RACE WALKING POSTUREHe used to receive negative attention in his village while training due to the posture required for race walking. "I won\'t mind admitting this, but race walking has a rather funny posture. So people do end up laughing. But the funny posture exists for a reason because the feet have to be planted on the ground. So when I used to run in my village, people used to laugh at me." (thebetterindia.com, 23 Aug 2016)EARLY DAYSHe worked a number of jobs in his youth, including farm labourer, dish washer and cleaner, to help support his family financially following the death of his father in 2002. When his application for a government job in the police was rejected in 2010 he considered quitting the sport, but his coach convinced him not to give up. "We used to get 1,500 rupees and had to survive the entire month on that. So [spending time on practice] wasn\'t an option. I told my coach I was quitting, I couldn\'t channel all my resources towards just walking anymore, and I had a family to sustain. But my coach convinced me that I had a future in this sport. I was running only 1:35 then, 15 minutes off what I\'m running now. So I\'m indebted to him for keeping me on." (sportskeeda.com, 16 Aug 2016) '), ('Hero', 'Australian race walker Jared Tallent. (scroll.in, 03 Jan 2017)'), ('Injuries', 'He suffered a knee injury a day before the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro, but went on to compete at the event. (sportskeeda.com, 16 Aug 2016)'), ('Education', 'Hemwati Nandan Bahuguna Garhwal University, India'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultOlympic Games1320km Walk2016Rio de Janeiro, BRA1:21:21World Championships2750km Walk2015Beijing, CHN3:57:11Commonwealth Games620km Walk2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS1:22:22World Race Walking Challenge620km Walk2017Taicang, CHN1:23:581020km Walk2015Rio Maior, POR1:22:50')]

name: N. SIKKI
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began playing the sport in Hyderabad, India at age eight. She began her career as a singles player but injuries meant she later switched to doubles. (bwfbadminton.com, 01 Jan 2018; news18.com, 26 Apr 2018)'), ('Reason', '"I was around eight when one of my father\'s friends asked him to take me to a badminton summer camp. Around 200 people participated in a tournament that was held there and I won it. The coaches there spotted my talent and told my father to send me there regularly." (sportskeeda.com, 03 Apr 2018)'), ('Debut', '2009 for India (bwfbadminton.com, 2016)'), ('Coach', 'Tan Kim Her [national], MAS; Pullela Gopichand [national], IND (sportstarlive.com, 04 Mar 2018; news18.com, 26 Apr 2018; shethepeople.tv, 09 Oct 2017; scroll.in, 18 Oct 2017; telanganatoday.com, 23 Apr 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a medal at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (shethepeople.tv, 09 Oct 2017)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralNEW SERVICE RULEShe is not a fan of the new service rule implemented by the Badminton World Federation from 01 March 2018. According to the rule, the whole of the shuttle should be below 1.15 metres from the surface of the court at the time of contact by the server\'s racket, compared to the previous rule of being below the player\'s waist. "This is how BWF and service judges have been playing with our career. Looks like they don\'t really care about our years of struggle and hard work to achieve our goals." (indianexpress.com, 11 Mar 2018) '), ('Influence', 'Coach Pullela Gopichand, because he also overcame injuries throughout his career. "He became my mentor, guide, coach and philosopher." (telanganatoday.com, 23 Apr 2018)'), ('Relatives', 'Her partner B. Sumeeth Reddy has also represented India in badminton, and placed fifth in the doubles event at the 2018 India Open in New Delhi. Her father has played volleyball at national level in India. (SportsDeskOnline, 30 Apr 2018; sportskeeda.com, 03 Apr 2018; sportskeeda.com, 03 Apr 2018)'), ('Injuries', 'A bout of typhoid forced her to miss the 2018 Thomas and Uber Cup in Pak Kret, Thailand. (espn.in, 29 May 2018)She injured her left knee early on in her career, in 2009, which resulted in four knee surgeries. It is due to this injury that she switched to doubles. (telanganatoday.com, 23 Apr 2018; sportskeeda.com, 17 Dec 2012)'), ('Education', "Business Administration - St Ann's College for Women, India"), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi, Telugu'), ('Highlights', name: MIRABAI CHANU
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began weightlifting in 2008 at Khuman Lampak Sports Complex in Imphal, India. (iwf.net, 23 Apr 2018)'), ('Reason', 'She was inspired to try the sport after watching Indian weightlifter Kunjarani Devi. "I was baffled at how she was lifting such heavy weights. So I told my parents that I wanted to do this, and with some reluctance they agreed." (sportskeeda.com, 24 Jul 2016)'), ('Coach', 'Vijay Sharma [national], IND; Anita Chanu [personal], IND, from 2008 (firstpost.com, 17 Mar 2018; iwf.net, 23 Apr 2018)'), ('Training', 'She trains at the National Institute of Sport in Patiala, India. (iwf.net, 23 Apr 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win gold at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia and the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (hindustantimes.com, 05 Apr 2018)'), ('Awards', 'She was named the 2017 Weightlifter of the Year at the Times of India Sports Awards [TOISA]. (indiatimes.com, 15 Mar 2018)She was named Best Lifter at the 2013 National Junior Championships in Guwahati, India. (sportskeeda.com, 24 Jul 2016)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralEARLY DAYSShe first tried weightlifting in 2008 at the Khuman Lampak Sports Complex in Imphal, India, although she had originally gone there in the hope of taking up archery. However, she met weightlifting coach Anita Chanu while she was there and was persuaded to try the sport. "When I was growing up, I did stuff like wood cutting, at nearby hills, bringing them up by myself and then fetching water from nearby ponds, in milk powder cans. [Anita Chanu] told me to bring bamboo trunks, to be used as barbells, for technique training. In weightlifting, you have to start with technique training, building body strength comes later. I had to find some nice bamboo trees near my house and cut them to be used as a kind of a barbell. This continued for around a month. Once the technical training was done, I shifted to normal training." (iwf.net, 23 Apr 2018) '), ('Hero', 'Indian weightlifter Kunjarani Devi. name: DHRUV
bio: [('Beginning', 'He took up the sport at age six. "[My first game] was in the 32nd Milestone [sporting complex], which still exists in Delhi. I scored a 63. I was six at the time and was wanting to bowl desperately after watching my dad. The ball was too heavy, but my dad said, \'Just go there and enjoy yourself\'. I was so happy I cried." (qubicaamf.com, 30 Oct 2017)'), ('Reason', '"My dad, Harsh Vardhan Sarda, started bowling when the first lanes were put up in India in the 1980s. He has represented India at the World Cup in 1999 and 2004 and is a three-time national champion himself. I used to go and watch him bowl when I was young." (qubicaamf.com, 30 Oct 2017)'), ('Coach', 'Andrew Frawley [national] (scroll.in, 13 Feb 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win medals for India on the international stage. (qubicaamf.com, 30 Oct 2017)'), ('Memorable', 'Competing at the World Cup in Poland in 2014. "For me, representing India at Poland in 2014 was the favourite by far as India finally cracked the top 24." (qubicaamf.com, 30 Oct 2017)'), ('Awards', 'He was named Best Bowler of the Year in 2006/07 by his school, Bluebells School International, in New Delhi, India. (Linkedin profile, 05 Sep 2014)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralFIRST FAMILY OF BOWLINGThe prevalence of elite-level bowlers in his family means they have sometime been referred to as India\'s \'First Family of Bowling\'. "Bowling is the primary cause of all our conversations debates and arguments ! But that\'s one bond that keeps the family together. We talk a lot about each other\'s games, how to improve it and at times relive old memories and stories. It\'s still not that big in India and is often seen as an entertainment activity. But, if more people know about the sport, I\'m sure a lot of kids would like to take.up bowling seriously and hence, India could become a stronger nation in bowling." (qubicaamf.com, 30 Oct 2017)OCCUPATIONHe gave up his career as a computer animator to become a professional bowler, but continues to work as a freelance animator to help fund his bowling career. (Linkedin profile, 05 Sep 2016) '), ('Relatives', 'His brother Harshavardhan Sarda has represented Team Delhi in tenpin bowling and the pair have competed together domestically. Their father Harsh Vardhan Sarda has bowled internationally for India, is a former national champion, and was the first Indian to win four international bowling trophies. His mother Anuradha Sarda has bowled at national level and his sister and her husband are also elite-level bowlers in New Zealand. (qubicaamf.com, 30 Oct 2017)'), ('Education', 'Picasso Animation College, New Delhi, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultAsian Games13Team of Five2010Guangzhou, CHN590223Trios2010Guangzhou, CHN355740Singles2010Guangzhou, CHN124043Doubles2010Guangzhou, CHN221858All Events2010Guangzhou, CHN4859World Championships31Team of Five2010Munich, GER39Doubles2010Munich, GER64Trios2010Munich, GER110Singles2010Munich, GERAsian Championships9Team of Five2012Hong Kong, CHN597714Trios2015Bangkok, THA373817Team of Five2016Hong Kong, CHN548120Team of Five2015Bangkok, THA559625Trios2012Hong Kong, CHN345926Doubles2015Bangkok, THA245428Trios2016Hong Kong, CHN336331All Events2012Hong Kong, CHN493141Doubles2012Hong Kong, CHN232342Singles2012Hong Kong, CHN121551Doubles2016Hong Kong, CHN220658All Events2015Bangkok, THA482360Singles2015Bangkok, THA1222109All Events2016Hong Kong, CHN4309123Singles2016Hong Kong, CHN1020Asian Indoor and Martial Arts Games3Doubles2017Ashgabat, TKM9Team of Four2017Ashgabat, TKM14Singles2017Ashgabat, TKM')]

name: RAHI JEEVAN
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up shooting in 2007 and began competing in 2008. (issf-sports.org, 30 May 2013)'), ('Reason', 'She was inspired to take up the sport after watching Indian shooter Tejaswini Sawant win gold at the 2006 Commonwealth Games in Melbourne, VIC, Australia. Although rifle shooting was more popular, she took up pistol purely for convenience. "Wearing the suit and setting up the equipment in rifle shooting was too cumbersome for me. So I picked up the pistol where I could shoot wearing my jeans and T-shirt." (dnaindia.com, 25 May 2011; The Hindu, 14 Oct 2008)'), ('Debut', '2008 for India (gunforglory.in, 14 Jan 2012)'), ('Coach', 'Munkhbayar Dorjsuren [personal], from 2017 (thebetterindia.com, 23 Aug 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (thebetterindia.com, 23 Aug 2018; SportsDeskOnline, 01 Sep 2018) '), ('Hero', 'Indian shooter Tejaswini Sawant. (rediff.com, 27 Dec 2011)'), ('Injuries', 'In 2013 she sustained an undisplaced fracture of the radial head of her elbow after falling on her right arm. The injury was undiagnosed at first and she competed through pain before taking up treatment in 2016. She was unable to pick up a gun for seven months but was able to avoid surgery. She returned to full fitness in December 2016. name: SHIVAM
bio: [('Beginning', "He took up the sport in 2012 at his grandfather's shooting range. (issf-sports.org, 01 Jul 2015; sportskeeda.com, 01 Jun 2016)"), ('Reason', '"It so happened that my grandfather, who was earlier a coach for the Indian shooting team, also happens to design ranges for shooting. He designed a range, which was five minutes away from my home. He got a pamphlet home and I saw it. I just thought about giving it a try. So I visited the range, gave it a shot and felt good. So my grandfather said that if I wanted to come and practise, I could do so, and so I went to the range, felt interested and hence began shooting from there." (sportskeeda.com, 01 Jun 2016)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralOCCUPATIONHe joined the Indian Air Force under a sports quota programme that allows him to train and compete internationally. (tribuneindia.com, 18 Jun 2018) '), ('Hero', 'His grandfather. (sportskeeda.com, 01 Jun 2016)'), ('Relatives', 'His grandfather has been a coach of the Indian shooting team. (sportskeeda.com, 01 Jun 2016)'), ('Education', 'Commerce'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Hobbies', 'Billiards, football, trekking. (issf-sports.org, 01 Jul 2015)'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultJunior World Championships1425m Rapid Fire Pistol2017Suhl, GER5683325m Pistol2017Suhl, GER568')]

name: HEENA
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began shooting in 2006. (heenasidhu.com, 24 Feb 2018)'), ('Reason', '"My uncle had a business in guns so that was how I was exposed to pistols from my childhood. It was in 2006, while I was preparing for my pre-medical entrance exams that I thought of shooting, just as a hobby. At that time it was only meant as a distraction from a hectic schedule, including hours of studying. I never thought that this is what I would eventually end up doing for the rest of my life. But when I decided to take up shooting my family supported me wholeheartedly. And the rest is history." (heenasidhu.com, 24 Feb 2018)'), ('Debut', '2009 for India, World Cup in Changwon, Republic of Korea (issf-sports.org, 10 Nov 2013)'), ('Coach', 'Ved Prakash Pilaniya [national], IND; Ronak Pandit [husband], IND (firstpost.com, 18 Feb 2018; sportsauthorityofindia.nic.in, 13 Feb 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a medal at the Olympic Games. (Facebook page, 22 Mar 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Being ranked number one in the world in April 2014. (heenasidhu.com, 24 Feb 2018)'), ('Awards', "In February 2018 she was named in the India '30 Under 30' list by the Forbes Magazine. (inuth.com, 05 Feb 2018)In 2014 she was presented with the Arjuna Award by the Indian government. (firstpost.com, 18 Feb 2018)"), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralSHOOTING CENTREShe and her husband Ronak Pandit, a gold medallist at the 2006 Commonwealth Games in Melbourne, VIC, Australia, have set up shooting centres in Mumbai and Pune in India to promote the sport among young people. "When I started shooting in 2006, there were no coaches who understood the art and science of shooting. I learnt pistol shooting by reading articles and watching videos of elite shooters on the internet. I was fortunate to understand the basics of pistol shooting from these articles and videos, but still I had to make a lot of changes in my technique as I started competing at high levels, mostly because I did not have an experienced coach to guide me as a beginner. Because of the challenges that I faced in the formative years of my shooting career, it was always my dream to help the young talent of this country in understanding the sport of pistol shooting." (heenasidhu.com, 01 Jan 2018) '), ('Relatives', 'Her husband Ronak Pandit competed in shooting for India at the 2006 Commonwealth Games in Melbourne, VIC, Australia. Her father Rajveer, her mother Rominder Kaur and her brother Karanbir have also represented India in shooting. (bhaskar. catchnews.com, 02 Dec 2017; sportscelebfamily.com, 01 Apr 2017)'), ('Education', 'Dentistry - Gian Sagar Medical College, Patiala, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi, Punjabi'), ('Hobbies', 'Painting, drawing. (Facebook page, 22 Mar 2018)'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultAsian Games210m Air Pistol Team Women2010Guangzhou, CHN1140325m Pistol Team2014Incheon, KOR1729510m Air Pistol Team Women2014Incheon, KOR1134910m Air Pistol2010Guangzhou, CHN3811310m Air Pistol2014Incheon, KOR3781725m Pistol2014Incheon, KOR572Olympic Games1210m Air Pistol2012London, GBR3821410m Air Pistol2016Rio de Janeiro, BRA3802025m Pistol2016Rio de Janeiro, BRA576World Championships1210m Air Pistol2010Munich, GER3821610m Air Pistol2014Granada, ESP381World Cup Final910m Air Pistol2014Qabala, AZE376World Cup825m Pistol2016Baku, AZE6910m Air Pistol2017Qabala, AZE3831010m Air Pistol2015Changwon, KOR3851110m Air Pistol2017New Delhi, IND3781210m Air Pistol2016Munich, GER3841210m Air Pistol2015Qabala, AZE3821310m Air Pistol Mixed Team2018Munich, GER7671410m Air Pistol2018Changwon, KOR5741710m Air Pistol2018Munich, GER5741810m Air Pistol2017Munich, GER3821910m Air Pistol Mixed Team2018Changwon, KOR7622110m Air Pistol2015Munich, GER3822410m Air Pistol2016Rio de Janeiro, BRA3792410m Air Pistol2015Fort Benning, GA, USA3812610m Air Pistol2016Baku, AZE3793425m Pistol2018Munich, GER5763725m Pistol2018Changwon, KOR5754225m Pistol2016Rio de Janeiro, BRA568DSQ25m Pistol2016Munich, GERDSQAsian Championships110m Air Pistol2015Kuwait City, KUW198.2110m Air Pistol2015New Delhi, IND197.8110m Air Pistol2014Kuwait City, KUW200.3310m Air Pistol2017Wako, JPN217.22225m Pistol2015Kuwait City, KUW565South Asian Games110m Air Pistol Team Women2016Guwahati, IND210m Air Pistol2016Guwahati, INDCommonwealth Games125m Pistol2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS38110m Air Pistol Pairs2010Delhi, IND759210m Air Pistol2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS234.0210m Air Pistol2010Delhi, IND481.6World Ranking (as of 01 Aug 2018)3510m Air Pistol20181765525m Pistol201832')]

name: SHREYASI
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began practising shooting after completing 10th grade at school. (dubeat.com, 12 Aug 2014)'), ('Reason', 'She was motivated to take up shooting by former Indian shooter Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore. (dubeat.com, 12 Aug 2014)'), ('Coach', 'Ennio Falco [national], ITA (sportsauthorityofindia.nic.in, 13 Feb 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralPERSONAL TRAGEDYShe lost her father due to a brain haemorrhage during the 2010 Commonwealth Games in Delhi, India. She started losing focus and consequently lost her spot on the national team. However, she remained dedicated towards the sport and practised hard to win a silver medal in a double trap event at the 2014 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow, Scotland. "I was very disheartened and upset. I couldn\'t perform well then, but it was my father\'s dream that I get a position in the Games. After 2010, when I started working on my game again, I was left out of the team. It for once discouraged me a lot. But it gave me strength, after all I was doing it all for my father. I earned my spot in the team back by working a lot." (dubeat.com, 12 Aug 2014) '), ('Relatives', 'Her grandfather Hari Shri, and her father Digvijay Singh, have been presidents of the National Rifle Association of India [NRAI]. (indianexpress.com, 27 Jul 2014)'), ('Injuries', 'She suffered a back injury during the 2014 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow, Scotland. She had to skip training for three days, but continued her participation in the event, and subsequently won a silver medal in a double trap event. (dubeat.com, 12 Aug 2014)'), ('Education', 'Business Administration - Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies, Faridabad, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultAsian Games3Double Trap Team2014Incheon, KOR2794Trap Team Women2010Guangzhou, CHN1818Trap Team Women2014Incheon, KOR1889Trap2014Incheon, KOR6610Double Trap2014Incheon, KOR9421Trap2010Guangzhou, CHN56World Championships22Trap2013Lima, PER6532Trap2011Belgrade, SRB6833Trap Mixed Team2017Moscow, RUS8636Trap2014Granada, ESP6740Trap2015Lonato, ITA6449Trap2017Moscow, RUS61World Cup10Trap Mixed Team2018Changwon, KOR13914Trap2015Larnaca, CYP6916Trap Mixed Team2018Tucson, AZ, USA12321Trap2018Tucson, AZ, USA9721Trap2015Qabala, AZE7022Trap2018Guadalajara, MEX10627Trap2015Al Ain, UAE6733Trap2018Changwon, KOR10635Trap2015Acapulco, MEX6338Trap2016San Marino, SMR63DNSTrap Mixed Team2018Guadalajara, MEXDNSAsian Championships8Trap2014Al Ain, UAE6812Trap2016Abu Dhabi, UAE6416Trap2013Almaty, KAZ6426Trap2017Astana, KAZ5527Trap2015Kuwait City, KUW62Commonwealth Games1Double Trap2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS962Double Trap2014Glasgow, GBR925Trap2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS19World Ranking (as of 01 Aug 2018)48Trap201822')]

name: Sudha
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up athletics at age 13 and began competing four years later in 2003 at a sports college in Lucknow, India. (economictimes.indiatimes.com, 28 Aug 2018; Athlete, 13 Sep 2014)'), ('Reason', 'She liked playing sports. (Athlete, 13 Sep 2014)'), ('Debut', '2005 for India, in China (Athlete, 13 Sep 2014)'), ('Coach', 'Nikolai Snesarev [national], BLR (tribuneindia.com, 19 May 2018)'), ('Awards', "She participated in the Queen's Baton relay ahead of the 2014 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow, Scotland. (glasgow2014.com, 10 Jul 2013) She was honoured with the prestigious Arjuna Award in 2012 for her sports performances. (archive.indianexpress.com, 23 Aug 2012)She was awarded with the Manyawar Shri Kanshiram Ji International Sports Awards in 2010 by the chief minister of Uttar Pradesh after her performance at the 2010 Asian Games in Guangzhou, People's Republic of China. (news.bspindia.org, 02 Feb 2011)"), ('Additional Information', "GeneralOCCUPATIONShe joined the Indian Railways under a sports quota programme that allows her to train and compete internationally. (hindustantimes.com, 10 Jul 2017)UPGRADED TO GOLDHer silver medal in the 3000m steeplechase at the 2013 Asian Championships in Pune, India, was upgraded to gold in May 2014 after it was ruled that the original winner, Ruth Chebet, was ineligible to represent Bahrain at the time. (indiatimes.com, 27 May 2014; SportsDeskOnline, 22 May 2018)NATIONAL FIRSTSAt the 2010 Asian Games in Guangzhou, People's Republic of China, she became the first Indian female athlete to win Asian Games gold in the 3000m steeplechase. She was also the first Indian athlete to compete in the 3000m steeplechase at the Olympic Games, following her appearance in the event at the 2012 Games in London. (indianexpress.com, 09 Jun 2012; ummid.com, 28 Dec 2010; SportsDeskOnline, 22 May 2018) "), ('Hero', 'Indian sprinter P. T. Usha. (Athlete, 13 Sep 2014)'), ('Influence', 'Her family and coaches Nikolai Snesarev and J.S. Bhatia. name: Shervegar
bio: [('Coach', 'Pete Conway [personal], GBR (thebridge.in, 06 Jul 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 06 Aug 2018)'), ('Additional Information', "Main classes currently sailed49er FX (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 06 Aug 2018)GeneralSELECTION APPEALIn July 2018 she and partner Varsha Gautham appealed to the Delhi High Court to challenge the decision of the Yachting Association of India [YAI] to not select the pair for the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia. The court ruled that YAI should hold an additional selection trial in Jakarta to confirm the team, but as the sailing venue was no longer available, the court then ruled that Gautham and Shervegar should be selected to compete at the Games. The Indian Olympic Association [IOA] complied with the court's decision and the pair were included in the Indian team to compete in Indonesia. They eventually won a silver medal in the 49erFX event. (newindianexpress.com, 04 Aug 2018; thehindu.com, 06 Aug 2018; sportstarlive.com, 07 Aug 2018; firstpost.com, 31 Aug 2018) "), ('Education', 'Medicine - YMT Medical College, Mumbai, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationClass World Championships5649er FX2017Porto, PORAsian Championships249er FX2018Jakarta, INA')]

name: SHIVA
bio: [('Beginning', 'He began boxing at age seven and was coached by his father Padam. (mapsofindia.com, 09 Jul 2013)'), ('Reason', '"Initially like any other guy, I too played soccer and I need to admit that I was good at soccer too. Later at one stage I tried out taekwondo also and I excelled in it too. But finally under my father I took up an individual game as my brother Gobind Thapa is also a boxer. I was only seven when I donned the boxing gloves." (easternpanorama.in, 01 Jun 2011)'), ('Coach', 'Santiago Nieva [national]; Gurbax Singh Sandhu [national], IND (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 02 Sep 2017; indianexpress.com, 10 Oct 2017)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (thehindu.com, 12 May 2017)'), ('Awards', 'In 2017 he received the Best Sportsperson UBC Award from the government of Assam in Guwahati, India. (Facebook page, 01 Jan 2018)In 2016 he received the Arjuna Award, the highest recognition for sports from the Indian government. (Facebook page, 01 Jan 2018)He received the Indian Chamber of Commerce [ICC] Sports Excellence Award for 2013. (Facebook page, 01 Jan 2018)He received the 2011 Breakthrough Performance of the Year at the India International Sports Summit in Mumbai, India. (Facebook page, 01 Jan 2018)In 2010 he received the Bharat Ratna Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi Trophy as Athlete of The Year from the Assam Sport Journalists Association in India. (Facebook page, 01 Jan 2018)He was named the 2010 Sportsperson of the Year at the Assam Sports and Cultural Festival in India. (Facebook page, 01 Jan 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralSTYLEHe changed the way he fights ahead of the 2016 Olympic Games in response to changes in the rules that rewarded a more attacking style of boxing. "I have been working on increasing my aggression. In today\'s boxing, there is no place for dormant boxers who like to backpedal and move around the ring without trying to throw punches and score points. Aggression is key. You don\'t have any option but to go for the kill. It\'s only when I am fighting in a competition that I will be able to judge if my aggression is in the right measure or am I going overboard." (livemint.com, 18 Jun 2016)YOUNGESTHe became the youngest athlete to have represented India in boxing at the Olympic Games when he competed at the 2012 Games in London at age 18 years and 247 days. He also became the youngest Indian boxer to have won a gold medal at the Asian championships, claiming victory in the bantamweight category at age 19 years and 213 days at the 2013 edition in Amman, Jordan. (SportsDeskOnline, 29 Jul 2018; Facebook page, 22 Jun 2016; sportskreeda.blogspot.com.au, 14 Feb 2014) '), ('Hero', 'US boxer Mike Tyson, Indian boxer Vijender Singh. (aiba.org, 30 Sep 2015)'), ('Influence', 'His father. (aiba.org, 30 Sep 2015)'), ('Relatives', 'His older brother Gobind has won medals in boxing at national level. (anglianmedalhunt.com, 09 Jul 2013)'), ('Injuries', 'He sustained a cut above his eye ahead of the 2016 Asia/Oceania Olympic Qualification Tournament. He was unable to spar in preparation for the event as a result of his injury. (livemint.com, 18 Jun 2016)'), ('Languages', 'English, Nepali'), ('Hobbies', 'Listening to music, football, swimming, horse riding, spending time with friends. (Facebook page, 01 Jan 2018)'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationAsian Games5Bantam (56kg)2014Incheon, KOROlympic Games17Bantam (56kg)2016Rio de Janeiro, BRA17Bantam (56kg)2012London, GBRWorld Championships3Bantam (56kg)2015Doha, QAT5Bantam (56kg)2013Almaty, KAZ9Light (60kg)2017Hamburg, GERAsian Championships1Bantam (56kg)2013Amman, JOR2Light (60kg)2017Tashkent, UZB3Bantam (56kg)2015Bangkok, THA17Light (60kg)2015Bangkok, THASouth Asian Games1Bantam (56kg)2016IndiaGrand Prix Usti1Light (60kg)2017Usti nad Labem, CZE')]

name: PRARTHANA GULABRAO
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began playing tennis at age seven in Barshi, India. (Facebook page, 28 Jun 2018; sportskeeda.com, 13 Jun 2016)'), ('Reason', 'Her grandfather encouraged her to take up the sport. "When I first started playing, there was just one small court that had no proper facilities. We didn\'t know what the proper rules were, we didn\'t have television to teach us, so we used to play what was taught to us by our elders. Over time, I realised tennis was a very different sport than what I had learned. It was when I started to beat more senior players as an amateur that my parents decided that I should take up tennis." name: Tajinderpal Singh
bio: [('Beginning', 'He took up shot put in 2006 in Khosa Pando village in Moga district, India. (economictimes.indiatimes.com, 28 Aug 2018)'), ('Reason', 'He used to play cricket as a child, but his father encouraged him to take up shot put. "My father wanted me to try my hand at individual sports as well. Once I started practising at the ground regularly, I started to develop a liking for the sport." (sportskeeda.com, 28 Mar 2018)'), ('Coach', 'Mohinder Singh [personal], IND (tribuneindia.com, 07 Mar 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning a gold medal in shot put at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia. (indiatimes.com, 26 Aug 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralFAMILY SUPPORTAfter winning a gold medal in shot put at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia, he revealed his father had been battling cancer for the previous two years. "This medal is my biggest achievement because a lot of sacrifices have been made. My family though never let me get distracted. They allowed me to chase my dream. A lot of sacrifices have been made by my family and friends and all those have paid today. My family never pressurised [me] to attend my father in hospital and it was always my friends who took care of all the hospital formalities in my absence." (indiatimes.com, 26 Aug 2018)OCCUPATIONHe joined the Indian Navy under a sports quota programme that allows him to train and compete internationally. (sportskeeda.com, 28 Mar 2018; timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 03 Apr 2018) '), ('Influence', 'His father. name: ELAVENIL
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up the sport in 2012 and began taking it seriously two years later in July 2014 at Sanskardham School. (thenewsminute.com, 10 Apr 2018; Athlete, 18 Aug 2018)'), ('Reason', 'The daughter of one is his father\'s students introduced him to the sport. "I have tried almost all sports except cricket, football and volleyball. My parents both played badminton and my father was also a state-level volleyball player so there were no restrictions. When I was handed my weapon and asked to take it up, I started just for fun but later on I became serious about it. No other sport gave me the satisfaction I wanted, but once I started shooting seriously, I got to know that this is the push-back I really wanted. In other sports, say boxing, you can hit the person harder and remove your frustration, but in shooting it is more challenging, you have to make yourself calmer. That\'s what attracted me to the sport." (scroll.in, 19 Jun 2018; Athlete, 18 Aug 2018)'), ('Debut', '2018 for India (Athlete, 18 Aug 2018)'), ('Coach', 'Suma Shirur (Athlete, 18 Aug 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia and win gold at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (hindustantimes.com, 13 Jul 2018; thenewsminute.com, 10 Apr 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning the individual 10m air rifle at the 2018 Junior World Cup events in Sydney, NSW, Australia, and Suhl, Germany. (Athlete, 18 Aug 2018)'), ('Hero', 'Indian shooter Gagan Narang. (thenewsminute.com, 10 Apr 2018)'), ('Influence', 'Indian shooter Abhinav Bindra. (Athlete, 18 Aug 2018)'), ('Relatives', 'Her father played volleyball at state level in India. (scroll.in, 19 Jun 2018)'), ('Nickname', 'Elvin, Bobo, Ela (Facebook profile, 16 Jul 2017; scroll.in, 19 Jun 2018)'), ('Injuries', 'She suffered a knee injury in March 2017 due to excessive workouts in the gym, but continued competing in competitions. (scroll.in, 19 Jun 2018)'), ('Education', "English Literature - Bhavan's Sheth R.A. name: VARSHA
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began shooting in 2011 in India. (Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)'), ('Reason', 'Her grandfather, who was a colonel in the Indian Army, encouraged her to take up shooting. "Also my father was a sport shooter for the Indian Forest Services [IFS] and as a kid, watching them was what made me interested to know more about it." (theoptimistcitizen.com, 13 Jul 2016; Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)'), ('Debut', '2011 (Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)'), ('Coach', 'Ahmed Al Maktoum, UAE, from 2018 (Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a medal at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (theoptimistcitizen.com, 13 Jul 2016)'), ('Memorable', "Winning bronze in the women's double trap team event at the 2014 Asian Games in Incheon, Republic of Korea. (Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)"), ('Awards', 'In 2015 she received the Vikram Award, which is the highest sporting honour in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. (theoptimistcitizen.com, 13 Jul 2016)In 2013 she was presented with an Ekalavya Award in India. The honour was in recognition of her sporting excellence. (theoptimistcitizen.com, 13 Jul 2016)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralTIME AT HARVARDShe studies law at Harvard University in Cambridge, MA, United States of America, where she has also competed on the women\'s varsity rowing crew. She receives financial aid in order to study there. "I had known about Harvard\'s financial aid before I applied, but it would be impossible to [be here] without it. I would not have pursued Harvard if I did not have financial aid. I remember getting my acceptance letter, and the financial aid letter comes with it, and I remember feeling like I\'d hit the jackpot. Growing up in one of the most rural places in the world, I would never have thought of coming to Harvard. Harvard was not something I even knew existed. The biggest thing for me would have been to just get a good job." (news.harvard.edu, 18 Apr 2017)EDUCATIONShe believes she would not have reached the same level in her shooting career if she had not pursued her education with an equal amount of dedication. "Education complements sport. All the mental training I need for my sport comes from education. All my life, what has kept my passion for shooting intact is the fact that I believe that even if my shooting career doesn\'t turn out to be the most successful one, I have a backup. It gives me the strength to put it all on the line when I\'m representing my country at events. Education provides the required maturity, composure and intellectualism for me in my field. I feel that every sportsperson in this country, however successful, must not let education play second fiddle in their lives. Believe me, all the tenacity you need to excel at your sport comes from education." (essentiallysports.com, 13 Oct 2014) '), ('Hero', 'Indian shooter Abhinav Bindra. (Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)'), ('Influence', 'Her parents. (Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)'), ('Education', 'Economics, Psychology - Harvard University, Cambridge, MA, USA'), ('Languages', 'English, French, Hindi, Italian, Punjabi, Spanish, Telugu'), ('Hobbies', 'Reading. (Athlete, 22 Aug 2018)'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationResultAsian Games3Double Trap Team2014Incheon, KOR27912Double Trap2014Incheon, KOR89World Cup33Trap2018Tucson, AZ, USA86Commonwealth Games4Double Trap2018Gold Coast, QLD, AUS86Junior World Championships7Trap Team Women2014Granada, ESP156')]

name: Gautham
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up the sport at age eight. (thenewsminute.com, 03 Jul 2018)'), ('Reason', 'She loved swimming, which led to her trying her hand at sailing. "Since I started sailing, it has been one of the most important parts of my life." (asianage.com, 23 Mar 2014)'), ('Coach', 'Pete Conway [personal], GBR (thebridge.in, 06 Jul 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a medal at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia. (sportstarlive.com, 07 Aug 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'Main classes currently sailed49er (newindianexpress.com, 04 Aug 2018)GeneralSELECTION APPEALIn July 2018 she and partner Shaila Shervegar appealed to the Delhi High Court to challenge the decision of the Yachting Association of India [YAI] to not select the pair for the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia. The court ruled that YAI should hold an additional selection trial in Jakarta to confirm the team, but as the sailing venue was no longer available, the court then ruled that Gautham and Shervegar should be selected to compete at the Games. The Indian Olympic Association [IOA] complied with the court\'s decision and the pair were included in the Indian team to compete in Indonesia. They eventually won a silver medal in the 49erFX event. "These were stressful three months. But everything has paid off. At least 10 times I thought, \'it\'s not worth it, I can\'t handle it,\' but somehow I continued." (newindianexpress.com, 04 Aug 2018; thehindu.com, 06 Aug 2018; sportstarlive.com, 07 Aug 2018; firstpost.com, 31 Aug 2018)YOUNGESTShe became the youngest Indian sailor to win a medal at the Asian Games when she won bronze in the women\'s 29er event at the 2014 edition in Incheon, Republic of Korea. (thebridge.in, 06 Jul 2018; edexlive.com, 29 Jun 2017; SportsDeskOnline, 17 Aug 2018) '), ('Injuries', 'In 2014 she broke two bones in her left foot. She was back on the water within two weeks with her cast waterproofed. In May 2014, during her first Olympic class event in Lake Garda, Italy, she injured her foot once again and could not compete after the first day. (theweekendleader.com, 06 Jun 2014)'), ('Education', 'Sociology - MOP Vaishnav College for Women, Chennai, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi, Malayalam, Tamil'), ('Highlights', 'RankEventYearLocationAsian Games329er2014Incheon, KORISAF World Championships5349er FX2014Santander, ESPClass World Championships4349er FX2015Buenos Aires, ARG5649er FX2017Porto, PORWorld Cup3449er FX2016Miami, FL, USA4049er FX2015Miami, FL, USAAsian Championships249er FX2018Jakarta, INA649er FX2016Abu Dhabi, UAEClass World Championships Juniors2149er FX2015Flensburg, GERWorld Ranking (as of 11 Jun 2018)6649er FX Individual Ranking2018')]

name: JYOTHI SUREKHA
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up archery in 2007. (newindianexpress.com, 27 Sep 2014)'), ('Reason', 'She initially competed in swimming but switched to archery due to a lack of international swimming coaches in her city. "I would have had to go to Bengaluru. I was quite young then and my parents didn\'t want to send me so far away. After some research, we settled on archery. I loved being in the water and initially, I didn\'t want to do archery. But as I got better at the sport, I knew this was for me." (deccanchronicle.com, 28 Aug 2017)'), ('Debut', '2011 for India (worldarchery.org, 22 Oct 2017)'), ('Coach', 'Jiwanjot Singh Teja [club, national], IND; Dhaneshwar Maida [national], IND (tribuneindia.com, 20 Jun 2018; tribuneindia.com, 29 Nov 2017)'), ('Ambition', 'To win a medal at the world championships and Olympic Games. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 31 Aug 2017; deccanchronicle.com, 28 Aug 2017)'), ('Memorable', 'Winning a bronze medal at the 2014 Asian Games in Incheon, Republic of Korea, and winning a gold medal at the 2015 Asian Championships in Bangkok, Thailand. (deccanchronicle.com, 28 Aug 2017)'), ('Awards', "In 2017 she received the Arjuna Award from the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports in India. (thehansindia.com, 30 Aug 2017; thehindu.com, 31 Aug 2017)She received the World Archery Federation's Golden Target award in 2013. (starlive24.in, 20 Dec 2013)"), ('Additional Information', 'Draw weight55lbs (worldarchery.org, 26 May 2018)GeneralFAMILY SUPPORTAs a young child her family relocated from Guntur to Vijayawada in India to give her access to better sporting facilities, and continued to support her financially throughout her sporting career. "Archery is an expensive sport and there were moments when I thought my parents were spending too much on me. But my father would say, \'When you\'re trying to achieve something big, we shouldn\'t worry much about finances.\' He would just ask me to focus on the result." (deccanchronicle.com, 28 Aug 2017) '), ('Education', 'Business Administration - Koneru Lakshmaiah Education Foundation, Guntur, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi, Telugu'), ('Hobbies', 'Reading, listening to music. name: KRISHAN
bio: [('Beginning', 'He began boxing at age 10 at the Bhiwani Boxing Club in India. (ndtv.com, 22 Jul 2012; msn.com, 26 Mar 2012)'), ('Reason', '"I took up boxing because most of my friends were doing it. Basically this sport is for tough people, so I also wanted to be tough and healthy." (ndtv.com, 22 Jul 2012; expressindia.com, 26 Nov 2010)'), ('Coach', 'Santiago Nieva [national] (sportstarlive.com, 14 Apr 2018; timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 02 Sep 2017)'), ('Ambition', 'To turn professional by the end of 2018. (scroll.in, 11 Apr 2018)'), ('Awards', 'He was presented with the Arjuna Award in 2012. (kanglaonline.com, 19 Aug 2012)He was named Best Boxer at the 2010 National Championships in New Delhi, India. (newkerala.com, 16 Jul 2010)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralOCCUPATIONHe joined the Haryana Police in India under a sports quota programme that allows him to train and compete internationally. (ANI Twitter profile, 19 Apr 2018)LONDON LOSSHe was eliminated from the 2012 Olympic Games in London in the preliminary round, despite initially being declared the winner. His opponent Errol Spence of the United States of America successfully appealed to the International Amateur Boxing Federation [AIBA] after claiming the referee had failed to notice Vikas committing fouls and intentionally spitting out his mouth guard. India lodged a counter appeal, which failed, and then took the case to the Court of Arbitration for Sport [CAS]. This was also unsuccessful. "There is no provision in the AIBA Technical and Competition Rules allowing for an appeal against the decision of the competition jury in relation to a protest. The decision of the competition jury is final and cannot be appealed," a statement from CAS said. (ndtv.com, 06 Aug 2012, 04 Aug 2012; dnaindia.com, 04 Aug 2012)NATIONAL FIRSTHe became the first Indian boxer to claim three medals at the Asian Games when he claimed bronze in the 75kg division at the 2018 edition in Indonesia. (india.com, 31 Aug 2018; SportsDeskOnline, 01 Sep 2018) '), ('Hero', 'Indian boxers Jai Bhagwan, Vijender Singh and Jagdish Singh. (thehindu.com, 02 Jun 2010; indianexpress.com, 20 May 2010)'), ('Injuries', 'A cut eyelid forced him to withdraw from his semifinal bout at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia. (thehindu.com, 29 Aug 2018; india.com, 31 Aug 2018)He suffered a hand injury in 2017. (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 01 Apr 2018)An eye injury meant he was unable to compete at the selection event for the India team in Patiala ahead of the 2014 Commonwealth Games. (intoday.in, 24 May 2014)He competed at the 2011 World Championships in Baku, Azerbaijan, with a injured wrist. He won a bronze medal at the event. (livemint.com, 20 Jan 2012)In 2011 he was unable to compete in the final of London Prepares, which was the test event for the 2012 Olympic Games. He had injured his left wrist in the semifinal of the event. (ndtv.com, 28 Nov 2011)'), ('Education', 'Kurukshetra University, India'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Hobbies', 'Running, football, music. name: VINESH
bio: [('Beginning', 'She got involved in wrestling at age seven in Haryana, India. (livemint.com, 05 May 2017; espn.com, 01 Jan 2016)'), ('Reason', 'Her uncle Mahavir Singh Phogat was a wrestler and motivated her to take up the sport. (espn.com, 01 Jan 2016)'), ('Debut', '2013 for India, Asian Championships in New Delhi, India (starsunfolded.com, 01 Sep 2017)'), ('Coach', 'Irbek Farniev [national], RUS; Kuldeep Malik [national], IND (timesofindia.indiatimes.com, 20 Feb 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To win gold at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (Twitter profile, 25 Mar 2018)'), ('Awards', 'In September 2016 she was presented with the Arjuna Award by the Indian government. (indiatimes.com, 03 Sep 2016)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralNATIONAL FIRSTShe became the first female Indian athlete to win a gold medal in freestyle wrestling at the Asian Games when she was victorious in the 50kg category at the 2018 Games in Indonesia. (indiatimes.com, 21 Aug 2018; SportsDeskOnline, 21 Aug 2018) '), ('Influence', 'Her cousins Geeta Phogat and Babita Phogat. (vervemagazine.in, 05 Aug 2016)'), ('Relatives', 'Her uncle Mahavir Singh Phogat was an amateur wrestler and is also a recipient of the Dronacharya Award, an honour given to coaches for their outstanding contributions in sports. Her cousins Geeta, Babita, Ritu, Sangeeta and Priyanka have all represented India in wrestling at international level. Her partner Somveer Rathi is a former national-level wrestler. (sportscelebfamily.com, 15 Mar 2017; huffingtonpost.in, 18 Aug 2016; newsbytesapp.com, 28 Aug 2018)'), ('Injuries', 'She injured her right knee during her quarterfinal bout at the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. The injury later turned out to be an anterior cruciate ligament [ACL] tear, and she was out of action until January 2017. (livemint.com, 05 May 2017)'), ('Education', 'Maharshi Dayanand University, Rohtak, IND'), ('Languages', 'English, Hindi'), ('Hobbies', 'Reading. name: PRANJALA
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began playing tennis at age six. (indiantennisdaily.com, 19 Nov 2017)'), ('Reason', 'She was encouraged to try the sport by her parents. "There was a tennis court near my house and they enrolled me there. After the initial few months, the coach started giving feedback to my parents that I had good potential and that I was already playing good rallies at a young age. Simultaneously, I got interested in tennis too and seeing my interest, my parents took my tennis a bit more seriously." (indiantennisdaily.com, 19 Nov 2017)'), ('Coach', 'CGK Bhupathi [club], IND (indiantennisdaily.com, 19 Nov 2017)'), ('Ambition', 'To be ranked in the top 300 players in the world by the end of 2019. name: Muhammed Anas
bio: [('Beginning', 'He took up athletics at the Style Sports Academy in Nilamel, India. (Athlete, 31 Jul 2016)'), ('Reason', 'During his school days he mainly competed in long jump. However, at a state-level school meet he was asked to participate in the 400m because his school was missing a runner for the race. "I ran it in close to 49 seconds. After that, I stopped doing long jump and started focusing only on the 400m." (newindianexpress.com, 26 Jul 2016)'), ('Debut', '2015 for India (Athlete, 31 Jul 2016)'), ('Coach', 'PB Jaikumar [personal] (hindustantimes.com, 17 Apr 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To compete at the 2019 World Championships in Doha, Qatar, and the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (aninews.in, 01 Sep 2018)'), ('Memorable', 'Qualifying for the 2016 Olympic Games at the 2016 Polish Championships in Bydgoszcz. (Athlete, 31 Jul 2016; intoday.in, 26 Jun 2016)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralOCCUPATIONHe is employed by the Indian Navy under a sports quota programme that allows him to train and compete internationally. name: AKASH
bio: [('Beginning', 'He took up the sport at age 12. (sportskeeda.com, 15 Feb 2016)'), ('Reason', 'He initially followed his brother into football. While he was training with a local club, he began to see other people playing sepaktakraw and decided he would like to try the sport. "By 2012 I made my national debut, and slowly I realised I was getting better. It was at this point that I decided to switch completely."
